title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow, Red Sox CBO, prioritizes hiring a general manager for the upcoming offseason.
The Red Sox have not had a general manager since Breslow's appointment in 2024.
Five assistant general managers are considered candidates, including 27-year Red Sox veteran Raquel Ferreira.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick, giving up a 2028 seventh-round pick in return.
Polk, drafted 37th overall in 2024, struggled with 12 receptions, 87 yards, and two touchdowns in his rookie season.
Polk's trade leaves only two players from the Patriots' 2024 draft class, including third overall pick Drake Maye.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots face the Dolphins in Week 2, seeking to end a five-game losing streak in Miami.
Under Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel, quarterback Tua Tagovailoa is 7-0 against the Patriots.
Miami's defense struggled in Week 1 against the Colts, allowing 272 passing yards and sparking a players-only meeting.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025, delivering a Southern Gothic-themed concert.
The performance included tracks from her albums, such as 'Willoughby Tucker, I’ll Always Love You' and 'Preacher’s Daughter'.
The concert concluded with the encore performance of 'American Teenager', with Cain joining the crowd for a shared singing experience.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior,' a film about a 59-year-old college football player's return to the field.
The film, directed by Rod Lurie, co-stars Rob Corddry and Mary Stuart Masterson and releases nationwide on September 19, 2025.
Chiklis, a Boston native, will attend an exclusive screening in Boston on September 14, held at AMC Boston Common 19.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are on the latest Forbes list of 400 richest Americans, ranked from 27 to 382.
Abigail Johnson is Massachusetts' richest person, ranking 27th nationwide with a net worth of $35 billion.
Patriots owner Robert Kraft ranks 78th on the list with a net worth of $13.8 billion.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox lost 4-1 to the Yankees, mustering only two hits in the series opener at Fenway Park.
Starter Lucas Giolito allowed two runs over 5.2 innings, but Boston made three errors in a sloppy game.
Boston Red Sox were 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position and are dealing with injuries to key players.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Washington Commanders' Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury in a game against the Packers.
Wise, 31, sustained the injury during a second-quarter play while attempting to block an extra point.
Wise, a former Patriot, signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders in March 2025.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early is a candidate to start the Red Sox's series opener against the Athletics next Tuesday at Fenway Park.
Early struck out 11 A's batters over five scoreless innings in his MLB debut, tying a Red Sox record for strikeouts.
Red Sox consider using Early and other young pitchers like Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison to manage rotation health.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Scott Boras and Alex Bregman will decide on contract opt-out after the Red Sox season ends.
Bregman's current contract is a three-year, $120 million deal with opt-outs after 2025 and 2026.
Bregman has impacted the Red Sox significantly, offering leadership and guidance to younger players.
